case.name: Cadbury Schweppes Pty Ltd v Darrell Lea Chocolate Shops Pty Ltd (No 5) [2006] FCA 850 (6 July 2006)

citphrases.citphrase: use of colour in connection with trade names
marketing from different sorts of premises
whether exception to the hearsay rule applies
whether discretion should be exercised to exclude survey evidence
opinion evidence as to likely consumer behaviour excluded
not outside the knowledge and experience of a trier of fact
evidence of opinion as to ordinary human nature not admissible
alternatively evidence would be excluded on discretionary grounds
notices inviting business entities to register a domain name
found to be a misleading representation that the notice was for the renewal of the recipient's existing similar domain name
whether trial judge should have required admissible evidence as to characteristics of recipients
whether recipients of notices members of a specialist market
whether a significant number of members of group must be misled

undesirable to award costs on separate issues unless good reason to do so. cretazzo v lombardi (1975) 13 sasr 4 ; j d m investments pty ltd v toddern pty ltd [2000] nswsc 432 , followed. aust dig procedure [557] procedure
ordinary for costs on an indemnity basis

order made only in exceptional circumstances. colgate-palmolive company & anor v cussons pty limited [1993] fca 536 ; (1993) 46 fcr 225 ; fountain selected meats (sales) pty ltd v international produce merchants pty ltd and others (1988) fca 202 ; (1988) 81 alr 397 , followed.
application that respondent's costs of certain issues be paid on indemnity basis
award on solicitor and client' or indemnity' basis

citances.sentence: Held the relevant evidence should have been admitted (also overturning [2006] FCA 363 and [2006] FCA 850). Held there was no passing off or breach of the Trade Practices Act Cadbury Schweppes Pty Ltd v Darrell Lea Chocolate Shops Pty Ltd (No 5) [2006] FCA 850 A decision concerning the award of costs resulting from the decision in [2006] FCA 446.
